column4: I need help with flashplayer's fullscreen performance, it's only perfect with Konqueror on my Kubuntu, and I need to find a fix for Ubuntu (I don't want Konq in Gnome
the controls are lagged a bit
no it's 32bit this time, because 64bit makes no sense unless 4gb ram
it can be beneficial with audio / video encoding decoding, even on <4Gb ram
what video card do you have?
I need help to get gnome+flash on youtube to work fluently, KDE's Konqueror handles it perfectly
ok then i can suggest you grab the 10.1 beta plugin and put the .so file in your browsers plugins folder, remove the current flash packages to prevent conflicts
tried that with worse resoults than current stable
what video driver are you running?
already tried if that's a compiz or metacity thing, same performance
you could try chromium browser, its a whole lot slicker than firefox, mind you vegemite is slicker
same performance on Chromium, I would even say FF 3.6.3 is better
its a later build of firefox and may help
